Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: Author Ty
Reviews.Content: I've had this set for almost 3 weeks, and I absolutely love it.  The picture is amazing; I compared it to sets with 1080p, and I like the picture on this one better.  The sound is also fantastic; loud, clear, and with several different settings for TV, movies, etc.  Speaking of settings, the menus are easy to follow and allow you to set the picture just the way you like it.  The remote is easy to use, and the only thing I don't like about it is that it has a slightly curved shape and tends to fall off the coffee table or sofa from time to time.  Otherwise, I'm really happy.  I did research for about a month and had a hard time deciding between this set and a Panasonic, but I'm glad I went with this one because it's fantastic.  One other note---do not buy overpriced cables for this or any other set!  I bought a $4 HDMI cable from Amazon and it works perfectly.  Why pay $20, $30, or even $50 for an overpriced cable that doesn't work any better?UPDATE APRIL 18:  I'm still loving this set, but I like it even more now that I've learned how to tweak the picture controls.  The default settings have the brightness controls set very high; once I turned that down, the picture looks even more amazing.  I also learned that I can set the picture and sound controls for each input device (cable box, dvd player, etc) and those settings will be saved and reappear each time that device is used.  This is really handy if you like to use different settings when watching a movie, for example.  My advice is to spend 10-15 minutes reading your manual carefully to learn what all the picture settings do, then adjust the picture to get it just the way you like it instead of using the default factory settings.  It makes a big difference!

Reviews.Title: Best Plasma Deal
Reviews.Author: Don G. Connell "Blu-Ray Nut"
Reviews.Content: I have tried to by a Plasma TV for 3 years now, but I always ended up with a LCD.  I recently have been looking for either a Panasonic or Samsung 50" Plasma for either my office or bedroom.  I have a 52" 650 series Samsung 1080p LCD in my Home theater Room that has great color, HD Detail and overall quality.  I have done alot of research on Plasma TVs and found that the fore-mentioned brands above, are the best rated. I debated the 1080p VS 720p issue and came up with the truth that, 50" and below sizes,720p will give you as good a picture on HDTV as 1080p.  Reason, most signals that are sent, are originally 720p anyway.  If you are not using a blu-ray player often and if you are 4-5' away, you will tell no difference. Finally, almost a month ago, I got an email from Amazon that had the 2 brands on their Sales Ad.  I really wanted to try the Panasonic Brand, but the best deal was on the Samsung.  Being that I have several Samsung Products now and know the top quality of the brand, I chose the Samsung PN51D450 51" 720p for under $700.00 and ordered it.  Delivery was about a week, timed appointment, white glove delivery and a nice knowledgable friendly delivery person.  I had read about the "burn in" issues with Plasmas, but with pixal shift and a scroll bar, that is not a issue any longer if you follow the 100-200 break-in period.  Yes, it is a pain, but it is well worth it.  You can find written instructions online on how to setup your Plasma before the seemingly, never-ending break-in time.  You need to find a channel that doesn't have a logo in one place, like a cable information channel, and just let it run.  I put mine in the bedroom, so I was running it 17 hours a day and with that, it was almost 2 weeks before the 200 hours was done.  Most experts recommend the 200 hours.  Once that is done, you may go in and adjust all of the settings to get the UNBELIEVABLE PLASMA PICTURE YOU HAVE HEARD ABOUT, from the experts !!!!!The Samsung is about 20lbs lighter than the Panasonic and that is a plus.  This Plasma is one of the lower priced ones that Samsung has, but you are only missing the "add on features" that have nothing to do with the picture.  The most debate for me was, did I really need 1080p.  For the usage I have for this set, 720p is great and it saved me several Hundred Bucks and that is a plus.If you don't have the desire to wait a couple of weeks to "break-in" the set, buy a LCD. If you want to own and see why all of the experts say that the Plasma is the best picture, try this set.  I think that you will be happy with the picture and I know you you will find a use for all of the money you are saving.Overall, I believe I made the correct decision, 1. as good a picture as you can find2. over 20lbs lighter than comparable brands 3.a 51" Plasma for under $700.00 !!!Just another fine Samsung Product.

Reviews.Title: Quality TV for the price
Reviews.Author: JPotter
Reviews.Content: I had been holding out for the 2010 42" Samsung Plamsa model to drop in price which I had been patiently watching since early November.  When the price was still the same come March - I decided it wasn't getting any cheaper.When to my surprise Amazon wasn't offering Free Shipping on that TV any, I noticed the 2011 Samsung Plasma's were available and with free shipping - I actually go the new model (which is now +1" to 43")for cheaper than last years Plasma.Out of the box the TV appearance is a nice liquid glossy-black finish.  Very thin TV - probably 1" deep in most spots (excluding where the mount attaches).  The input panel required plugs to be plugged in horizontally - so expect to have to have a punch-panel or hole in the wall on the lower left side of the TV screen (lower left if facing the TV) to get the connections to hook-up.  Why TV makers won't allow vertical input connections on TV's like this is beyond me.If not wall mounting it comes with a good quality stand - though one of the mounting holes on the TV was stripped on my mount out of the box - something I didn't discover until days later.  Since the free stand is temporary for me and I'll eventually wall-mount, I was not concerned.Picture quality is what you'd expect from a plasma - bright colors, good blacks, and a little bit of a glossy (reflective) screen.  The screen isn't too bad - I use it in a highly lit room and only if the sun is right on it does it bother me.This set is 720p - and after reading 1000 different opinions/tech articles on 1080p vs 720p and it doesn't matter because you can't really tell the difference unless you are too close.  I can say this - you CAN tell a difference if you are coming from 1080p to 720p.I have a bigger 50" 1080p TV in a different/home theater room.  It is also a Samsung - but a much older rear-projection LED (YES - LED, they offered it one way back year - new LED TVs are not rear-projection LED; they no longer make them).  The 1080p picture is silky smooth compared to this new Samsung.  Don't get me wrong, this set looks really good - if I hadn't spent 4 years watching TV on my other TV I would have never known.  But side by side looking close at the 720 screen you see clear pixels - there are no pixels on my 1080p 50" screen - no matter how close I look.  On this screen you can see pixels/not-that-sharp of an image from about 3' away.  That not-that-sharp image can be see from a distance - the picture just isn't as 'liquid' as my old 1080p.  However, until I saw it side-by-side I wouldn't KNOW better to complain - can you see the difference - yes.  But my point is you won't know any better till you've seen then side by side.  You don't know how clear it can be until you see it.That said it's still really good for the price and I'd would buy it again since ~$500 was my price range.Bottom-line this is a good 720p Plasma for the price, but if you are looking for that GREAT picture quality hold-out for a 1080p set.  If my 5 year old 1080p looks better than this brand new 720p, the new 1080s have to be even better.

Reviews.Title: My first Flat Screen
Reviews.Author: R. perisian "Rogerslake"
Reviews.Content: I paid $679 for this 2011 model of 51". After my 100 break in period, i turned up the contrast, brightness, and sharpness levels. I absolutely love it, and the sound is really quite good to me. While watching a movie on regular DVD, there are about 3" of black screen on the top and bottem of picture. After 2 hours of watching this, I turned off the movie, and noticed some burn in from it. After watching regular HD tv for about 10 minutes, it was gone. I have watched or left the tv on cnn for hours on end, and the ticker going across did not burn in.. There is no ghosting on plasmas either. Gonna go get me a blu ray now.

Reviews.Title: Samsung PN51D450
Reviews.Author: Jon N
Reviews.Content: I have bought a number of flat panel tvs in the past and was looking a new tv with decent performance with a small bezel and fairly light as I needed to fix the tv to a plaster/concrete wall. Plasmas tend to give significantly better bang for the buck compared with LCD, so while the LCD TV were typically 10lb lighter for a 50" screen, the cost was in the region of 50%+ higher for the same form factor.I did look at the LG plasmas as I have a 60" LG 1080p in my main viewing room, as I found them to be solid quality and good value. I nearly bought the 1080p LG 50" which was only 10%-15% more than this unit, but was put off by the fact that it weighed 60lb v 50lb for the Samsung.I don't need internet connectivity as I get internet content from my TiVo, so the base model suited my needs. As for 1080p v 720p, at my viewing distance of 12' I understand its not possible to tell the difference - this is certainly consistent with my experience. The picture quality is very good - the biggest constraint is the quality of the feed from my cable provider. I avoid watching SD content where possible so have limited experience of how the Samsung does here.As for plasma burn-in issues, I have had a bunch of plasmas and have never had an issue with them watching regular TV. I can't comment on the sound quality as I use a separate receiver.All-in-all, this is a great tv, with very good picture quality and smallish form factor for a great price.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 450 43" 720p Plasma TV
Reviews.Author: Crusher
Reviews.Content: This Plasma TV is INCREDIBLE!!  I have been researching HD TV's for 2 years and kept going back and forth between LED & Plasma.  Trust me, if your primary reason for purchasing a TV is picture quality there is not comparison to the RICH colors of Plasma.  If you are a sports fan, this is the TV to buy!  Just keep in mind where you locate the TV in a room that you do not have a window or excessive brightnes behind it but the colors are "real" and PLASMA is definitely the way to go.  Oh ya, lets not forget the price at Amazon $539.00 with no sales tax & free shipping.

Reviews.Title: Solid TV for the Price
Reviews.Author: C. Brown
Reviews.Content: I wanted to buy a 42" flat screen for my bedroom and was deciding between this TV and the Panasonic VIERA TC-P42X3 42-Inch 720p Plasma HDTV. I don't watch that much TV in my bedroom so a 720p is just fine and I've read you can barely tell the difference between 720p and 1080p. I have also heard that plasma is the way to go over LED and LCD (best picture quality of the 3). The Panasonic model does come with an ethernet port which can take a separately purchased wireless adapter so you can get apps like Netflix, Facebook, etc. on your TV screen. However, a lot of the reviews complained about screen glare. Plus, I bought a Samsung 50" 1080P plasma for my family room in 2008 and it works beautifully. So I went with the Samsung...The TV looks great out of the box and the stand is very sturdy. The only problem with the stand is that it does not swivel from side to side so you have to pick up the tv and move the stand if you want to change the viewing angle. The plug and play setup is a breeze and you can be watching TV within 30 seconds after plugging in the power and HDMI cable. It only has 2 HDMI ports but for me that's not a problem because I have one going into my Direct TV and the other into a DVD player. I watched Band of Brothers on DVD last night and the picture quality looked great. You can notice a window or sunlight glare if it faces directly on the screen but just close the blinds if this really bothers you. If I put it up side by side with my Samsung 50" 1080p plasma I might be able to notice a slight difference but I doubt it. Overall this is a solid TV for the price and is a perfect TV for the bedroom.PS - remember to buy the cheap HDMI cables on Amazon. They work just as well as the expensive ones!

Reviews.Title: Plasma is the way to go!
Reviews.Author: E. Soboll "Eddy"
Reviews.Content: Just got this TV! Was wondering between Panasonic and Samsung and LCD vs. Plasma. I bought this one to replace my Panasonic Viera 32" 720p LCD. My room to watch is not so big and the space to place the tv was just right. I don't have a home theater and just use HD from the Comcast source.The sound is great! The colors are bright and the image response is incredible fast. For sure is not a 1080 (which for this price, still the best buy!)And this is 43inch!No regrets in getting this! The price, no sales tax and free shipping!! It came in time fashion and right when they told that was going to be here.If you still wondering about this, pull the trigger, you will NOT regret!!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV, but it doesn't play Videos from USB
Reviews.Author: Emily
Reviews.Content: The TV is wonderful. Great size, great picture, easy interface. It makes a cute little song when you boot it up and when you shut it off. I just want to point out that the 43" does not in fact play videos from the USB (just confirmed with tech support and everything). This is really annoying because that was one of the major perks I wanted from a new TV. Looking at the product description now, I realize that the feature list applies to the D450 series as a whole, and that each model's capabilities are listed below. Kind of a dumb oversight on my part, but it's equally stupid to put an description that does not apply on the listing for a very specific model. Just sayin.

Reviews.Title: D450 or D550
Reviews.Author: kohut
Reviews.Content: I've recently purchased both this tv and the D550 from Best Buy, spending a few hundred more on the D550. This tv replaced the old tube tv downstairs and the D550 replaced a 37" lcd in our living room. After bringing both of these mammoths home, setting them up, and watching a few movies on each of them... both my wife and I decided that we can't tell any big difference the D550 has over the D450 picture quality wise. In fact, I think the blacks are deeper on this model! Long story short, we returned the D550 and purchased this model for the living room too, saving a few hundred bucks! The only advantage the D550 had was the 3D display, which will only make you spend more money on 3D equipment. This tv offers unbelievable value!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful and high quality
Reviews.Author: MuleHeadJoe
Reviews.Content: Absolutely no trouble at all. The picture is beautiful, the casing is beautiful, setting it up was easy as pie. This is the second Samsung plasma I've bought and I'm impressed with their quality and ease of use. If you can get this on sale and/or with free shipping, then you can't beat this tv for quality versus price.

Reviews.Title: All good things...
Reviews.Author: Robert Hale
Reviews.Content: So be aware that I'm not a videophile that is going to notice every little detail. I wanted a TV for the living room, not a product that I would obsess over and proclaim it's vast technical superiority to everyone I bump into. It's for watching movies; I don't need to marry it.With that said, it's been a great TV. It's sharp, (in some ways, too sharp... actors are more attractive when you couldn't see their pores) and the color is great. I've never noticed blur or anything else that anyone might complain about. I've used it for the occasional video-game session as well, and there's no issues; it works well.The TV mounted perfectly, has enough connections, and the menu system is simple enough to figure out. It's a solid, quality product, and people who come over to watch a movie aren't complaining. Neither am I; I'm more than happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Best Bang for Your Buck
Reviews.Author: Anrthony M. Wirz
Reviews.Content: I have been TV shopping for quite awhile before settling on this unit. I looked at LCD, Plasma, LED and TVs from Samsun, LG, and Panasonic. What it came down was that I wanted to Stay under 550$ while getting the biggest screen I could.I was nervous about going with plasma because I am accustomed to LCDS but the picture is gorgeous, the display is very thin, the speakers are good enough, and the remote is responsive(more than I can say about my brothers 40 and 50 inch Samsung LCD remotes)I have had my laptop, apple tv 2, and an htpc hook up to it all flawlessly and I am very happy with my choice. The only thing to complain about is it only having 2 HDMI ports but that has not been an issue for me at all so far.Great TV for the Money, no doubt about it.UPDATE: I have owned the TV for nearly 3 months now and it is still treating me very well. Its been great. I could only wish for another HDMI port or two

Reviews.Title: The best I've found in the price range
Reviews.Author: K. Poole "kylefpoole"
Reviews.Content: I'm not an videophile, but I am a geek.  I research everything way too much, obsess over minute details, and just generally put too much effort into purchase decision. I'm also cheap, and a bit proud that we only have 1 TV in our family of 4, and no cable.So when our 6 year old LCD bit the dust, I started obsessing over a new TV.  ~40" was the largest size that would fit in our entertainment center, and I didn't want to spend more than around $500.  I have an HTPC, so I didn't need a 'smart TV'.  I also find 3D annoying at the movies, so I didn't want that either.I started researching and settled on LCD.  I decided I needed 1080p, 120ghz, LED lighting and all the other buzz words out there.  I ended up buying 3 different ones, and taking each one back within a few days.  While each was nice, there was always something that was a bit off.  My price limit kept increasing, hoping I'd find the TV that looked good, had great picture quality, speakers good enough that I wouldn't have to run the stereo all the time, and would fit into my entertainment center.  After not finding what I was looking for, I went to Amazon, clicked on 'plasma tv' on a whim and sorted on 'average customer review' - the Samsung PN43D450 was at the top the list.The price was right.  Size was good too - and it offered a bigger viewable screen than anything else in the price range.  The TV looked good with the narrow bezel.  I was a bit put off by the lower resolution - after all 1080p is 'critical', and didn't know much about plasma - but the reviews were great, and I'd been disappointed in everything else so far, so I decided to give it a shot.  I'm glad I did.Picture quality is superb.  Yes - the 1080p LCDs are sharper, and brighter - but that's only part of the story when it comes to overall quality.  The colors on the plasma are superb.  The contrast is amazing.  Blacks are really black.  There's no weird motion stuff going on like I saw on some of the 120hz LCDs I brought home.  The speakers on the TV are excellent as well - miles ahead of anything else I tried and no need to use my stereo unless I really want a lot of bass. Our living room is set up in a way that we rarely are sitting directly in front of the TV - and the view angles on plasma really are better.  Netflix and Amazon Instant video through the HTPC, in both SD and HD look great.  Broadcast TV through my HTPC also looks superb.  Blu-ray is beautiful, too.  From a pure, visual, 'does this look great' standpoint, this TV rocks.  And it's the largest screen that will fit in my entertainment center, so it gets extra man-points for that, too.I did obsess for a while over 720p vs 1080p.  I considered raising my price limit again in order to get a 1080p Plasma, but in the end, I decided to just stick with the PN43D450.  It's great as is, and once I stop obsessing over the minute technical details, I won't be able to tell any difference between it and a more expensive unit anyway.So, in short - if you're looking for a TV with superb picture quality, great sound, in a great looking package at a very reasonable price - then put aside concerns over 1080p vs 720p, Plasma vs. LCD, etc - and just get this.  It's ranked high by real users for a reason. It does a phenomenal job at being a TV, and that's what really matters.  I'm very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV
Reviews.Author: S. Weld "musicman"
Reviews.Content: Product was shipped and protected. The day after I placed my order I got a personal call from one of the store owners and he personally thanked me for my order and asked if I had any concerns or questions. I was very impressed and pleased and will repeat my business with him and that company.After looking for a TV for little over a year, reading comments in Amazon from regular Joes and Janes and from all the TV aficiandos and listening to my co-workers, I decided upon this TV mainly for the price and that it was a plasma.I have experiences with LED/LCDs and decided against them because of the "fake look". The new plasma's such as this Samsung is incredible. The picture is beautiful for movies on Netflix, Hulu, and Dish TV. Playing Xbox 360 such as Halo Reach, Battlefield 1943, and Call Of Duty 3 is flawless.Of course the price was unbeatable for little over $600.00 for a 51" TV and the price for the extended warranty was priced right also. I bought it the moment I saw the price. This TV replaced my 2007 57" rear-screen Hitachi which still works, but some issues prevent me from enjoying it such as the TV shutting itself off. Very strange. This does not bode well with me especially after watching a horror flick. lol.The only thing that I didn't think about was that the new TV has only an audio jack for an fiber optic cable. I have a 2001 Sony 800 watt surround-sound system so my first thought was, "there ain't no way that my Sony has a fiber optic input". Well, there was one although I had never noticed it or I didn't know what that plug was for. So I got a 12' FO here at Amazon for $10.00.If you haven't heard sound through a fiber optic, you're missing a big part of the picture. Since I've been in high school (late 70s) I have only used RCA jacks. But the fiber optic is incredible. The sound replication is about as good as it gets. The first show that I watched with this new set-up was "Cheers". Now knowing how many times I have heard this intro song to this show is no big deal to me but upon listening to the show through my surround-sound / FO cable was like listening to a brand new show. I could hear the arrangement of the song that I had never heard before and it was crystal clear and very well produced. Same goes for many shows through Dish TV and Netflix. It improves the TV watching experience.One last comment. I didn't do the 100 hour break-in. I don't see a need with this new model but the only thing that I did was turn up the brightness slightly so I could watch TV. The day I had my TV I was watching it preset controls and nothing but dark scenes which made it unenjoyable. I treat my electronics with respect so I don't see any problems with doing this and no problems have arisen. All is good.

Reviews.Title: pn51d450
Reviews.Author: o0om0nkeyo0o
Reviews.Content: I HAVE HAD MANY SAMSUNG PLASMA TV MY OTHER TV IS SAMSUNG PN50D450 WITCH I LOVED THE BRIGHTNESS AND THE PICTURE AND SOUND IS GREAT.BUT THIS 2011 PN51D450 IS BY FAR THE BEST SLICK BLACK LOOK 1 INCH BIGGER SCREEN AND THE PICTURE QUALITY IS GREAT I WOULD RECOMEND THIS TV TO ANYONE WHO IS SHOPPING FOR A NICE PLASMA TV IN THIS PRICE RANGE.SAMSUNG WENT ABOVE QUALITY ON THIS ONE.AND I WOULD PUT IT UP NEXT TO A HIGHER PRICED PLASMA ANYDAY.JUST THOUGHT I WOULD PUT MY REVIEW OUT.

Reviews.Title: the most bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: emile vitella
Reviews.Content: Have never reviewed anything before, am writing this to help anyone out there having trouble making a decision. The picture is just incredible, can't imagine anything clearer or sharper than this. I had a new Samsung 1080 lcd which I returned because I was disappointed in the picture quality: this blows that picture away. My son has a new expensive lcd (xxxx) and this 720 plasma is better than his. Can't comment on anything other than picture quality, but if you want an amzing experience watching tv and movies there is none better.

Reviews.Title: Good purchase
Reviews.Author: Ashwini Pandey
Reviews.Content: Very good picture quality and price point. Thin bezel makes it look attractive in addition to add extra real estate and this makes the design double successful. 720p is fine with this size and does not look grainy at all. However, any size above this must be purchased with a minimum of 1080p. Overall, I am happy with the purchase....

Reviews.Title: Incredible
Reviews.Author: FrankZot
Reviews.Content: I will be brief. Forget the over priced LED`s. Plasma has surpassed LCD`s in picture quality and this set proves it. Not a lot of bells and whistles, but for the price the picture and sound quality is stunning.I did my research before this purchase and I am very well satisfied in my decsion. An incredible TV at an amazing price.

Reviews.Title: Simply Amazing
Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: I received my Samsung PN43D450 today around 12:35pmI had to leave before I could setup the TV so when I came back around 3:10pm I opened the box and finally saw this beauty :)It also seemed a little large lolOnce I installed the stand which is very stable, I plugged in the power and HDMI cable, and that is when the Magic really started!!!This TV accepts 1080p 60Hz from my Denon AVR-1910 and it converts the picture to its native resolution which is 1366x768 @ 720p, but I am telling youthat nobody will notice the difference between this 720p Plasma and an LCD, LED or DLP 1080p.I sure dont see any difference, but that is because this is a Plasma TV and its sure that for movies, sports and videogames nothing is better period!!!!I cannot express how happy I am with this purchase, and Samsung is the best on the market.My next TV will also be a Plasma and maybe 1080p but as of now I do not need it :)Also at 43 inches this TV is pretty huge compared to my LG 32 inch LCD TV.I am so glad I went with Samsung and I am fan for life.Go buy this TV and trust me when I say, you will not regret it at all, especially when its videogames and blu-rayBUY IT NOW!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Be aware!!
Reviews.Author: MrMarkyMark
Reviews.Content: Before buying this TV or any Samsung brand TV, do a Google on Samsung auto turn off and on. My Samsung 43 plasma was 7 months old when it auto turned off one day and made clicking noises and wouldnt turn back on. This is a widespread issue and there are class action lawsuits. For now, I would look to another brand.**update** Samsung service was excellent - TV was fixed in less than a week and warranty was extended by 90 days. I'm glad because the TV really is nice especially in this price range.

Reviews.Title: Excellent purchase for $430 @ TigerDirect.com, Black Friday 2011
Reviews.Author: ShiraKashi
Reviews.Content: Easy assembly & setup.  Beautiful screen & picture.  Remote & menu are easy to navigate and adjust settings.  Yes, a 1080p would be a notch better but I viewed this 720p TV alongside more expensive 1080p units and it rivaled them in every category.  Our home has no lighting/glare issues which I considered before purchasing.Advice from a pro video engineer I know: Never view a TV closer than the diagonal dimension of the screen.  So that should put to rest complaints about the picture when right up to the screen or 2 feet away, etc. Flaws can be found on any screen that close.Speakers are good & better than I expected especially for a unit only 2.2" thick.  I think some people expect too much in that regard.  That's why they make sound bars & home theatre systems.Regarding a reviewer's concern over screen damage by a child's sippy cup:  That's an unfortunate incident but child sippy cups are made of very durable plastic, often weighted at the bottom and with liquid make a formidable object when tossed whether they hit a plasma TV, LCD screen, a human being, etc.Blu-ray is dazzling to watch.  I  use the Panasonic DMP-BD210 blu-ray player and it's awesome.  Sports action is seamless.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely worth the money
Reviews.Author: techguy
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV about 6 months, and I absolutely love it.  It was bought to replace a HD tube TV, and I am glad I bought it vs. an LCD.Picture quality is great.  Plasma is better for movies and sports; due to its greater ability to produce deep blacks and blur free motion.  Some LCDs and LEDs now have higher refresh rates, but if you've ever paid super-duper close attention, you'll notice they make things look a little surreal, almost dream-like.  It's just not natural.  If you love movies and sports, Plasma is the way to go.  In regards to the 720 thing, most HD stations are 720p.  About the only realy 1080p source you can get is Bluray.  In my home, you sit about 6 ft from the screen, and you can't tell.  If you sit further away, you probably can, but like I said, it's perfect for our home.  Also, next to my cousin's 40" LCD, the picture is just so much smoother.The sound is adequate (it will never be great on such a thin bodied machine) and the menus are easy to use.  I wish the digital tuner was a bit stronger, but whatever.The two HDMI ports disappoints me.  I wish it had just one more.  To be honest, that's my only major complaint.  I know I can get a better TV with a better picture, but then I'd be spending A LOT more than what I did on this one.  It's your choice.

Reviews.Title: An amazing HD performance for its price!
Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: Right off the top I'm going to say that this set was the absolute value winner for me over TVs in its class and price range at area stores where it was sold. No question about it, I am thrilled I selected this set over LED and LCD TVs that were in the 42-47" classes and for its incredibly sharp picture, rich color reproduction, crystal clear and full-sounding audio, and ease of setup, it gets 5 stars.I had owned a 50" Samsung DLP for almost nine years and had replaced the lamp three years ago and continued to produce a decent (but not great) picture up until recently when the set finally died. It would have cost us $300 to repair a nine year-old set that was built on outdated technology. I decided to shop for a new set to see what I was up against. I dreaded that the prices would be out of our range, but was blown away when I spotted this set sitting on a shelf in between other LCD an LED TVs at our local warehouse club.The old DLP set had a matte screen that did nothing to ease sun glare in our living room. The audio was not that clear and we had fluctuating audio levels all the time. You also could not view it well at an angle. The new 51" plasma set had none of those issues. The screen picture is bright (on Standard setting), and even though it has a glossy screen, sun glare does not affect the viewing even close to as much as the matte DLP screen did. I can be in the adjacent living space and look over at the TV at an approximate 10 degree angle from the front of the screen and make out all the details. The sound is very crisp and rich for built-in TV speakers. I had never heard such good sound come from an out-of-the-box set before.I watched a college football game on it this afternoon and was blown away at how well the set handled fast motion. Truly, being a 720p set made me not care so much about 1080p. I don't even have to go in to all of the other good features for this set. My only wish is it had another HDMI port (the set has only two). I got a Blu-Ray player for my birthday a couple weeks ago and the picture from it is absolutely stunning.Just get this set. You are not going to find another HD set of comparable quality in this size class.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE THIS SAMSUNG TV! GREAT TV!
Reviews.Author: I. J. S. "John"
Reviews.Content: I love this Samsung TV! Great TV. Great picture and great sound. I bought it from Amazon.com on June 18, 2011 and received it on June 23, 2011. It works great. The remote control is easy to use. It changes channels very fast. It only takes 1 second to change channels.  I have no problem with glare. I watched TV during the daytime and nighttime and I see no glare. I was always worried about glare but I see no glare. Let me say my #1 choice was a Sony but it was too expensive for my budget and it was also a smaller 40 inch TV. Panasonic was my second choice because I already own a 32" Panasonic standard tube TV. Samsung was my third choice and cheapest price of the three brands. But I am very happy with my purchase. I always wanted a 42 inch TV and the Samsung TV is 1 inch bigger. I got FREE shipping from Amazon.com. Amazon.com Pilot services delivered the TV and set up the TV in 10 minutes. The sound is great. I usually watch regular TV shows with volume set at 20 volume level and I hear clear sound. I have my regular DVD player connected to the TV using an HDMI cable and the DVD picture and sound is amazing. I use a 5.1 surround sound system to watch DVD movies. I use the TV speakers to watch old classic TV series on DVD. The TV has bright beautiful colors if you set the picture control to DYNAMIC MODE. Turn off the SRS surround sound on TV and set sound mode to MOVIE MODE for loudest volume sound from TV speakers. The Samsung customer service is very friendly. They helped me connect my DVD player using an HDMI cable to the TV set. You will not regret your purchase. I didn't.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this junk!
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Armstrong "bunwhisper"
Reviews.Content: A week ago, I would have said I loved this TV. Oh how things change in an evening. Last night, my four month old tv blew up. Was just sitting there watching HGTV and KEE-RACK! Horrible cracking noise, the picture goes black, sound goes dead. TV is now deader than Elvis. So I call Samsung, as it is still in warranty--they will not authorize an exchange or anything until a repairman sees it. So they set me up with a repair place that does no speak no Ingles. Guy says he will order parts, but *wont come out to see what is wrong with the tv*. How do you know what is wrong without seeing the set--and also, Samsung said they cannot do anything until the repairman looks at the set. "Is no problem, I fix." I call Samsung back, and ask how someone can order parts *when he has no idea what is wrong with the set*. They don't know, and have now sent me to another repair place, who *also* orders parts before seeing the tv, but at least speaks English. Any odds that when/if the part gets here and when/if they come out to see the set *it will be the wrong part*? Yeah, I wouldnt take that bet either. Avoid this junk!

Reviews.Title: Decent TV, ideal only as secondary.
Reviews.Author: Jon Knocks
Reviews.Content: Now to start this review off I'll admit that I didn't do enough research on the product before purchasing it so many of my disappointments could have been avoided with more research.First the good:pretty slim around 2" in depthnice screen size fitting a 43" screen in a 42" base600hz refresh rate good for fast motionGreat contrast (of coarse plasma)and that's about it...The no so good:For some reason plasmas aren't 1280 x 720 or 1366 x 768 like LCD 720p televisions but rather 1024 x 768. This translates to a picture that looks like a early 2000's crt computer monitor...just stretched out, so this really isn't a good choice to use as an external display for a computer because your losing 200+ pixels horizontally.Not only for a computer, but other devices will look kind of awkward on this unit also. I must say the xbox 360 formatted the image pretty well though.The next issue was the constant buzzing sound that came from the back of the tv. It wasn't mounted on a wall and we sat about 8 ft. away...but when the sound was low you could here a buzzing CRT TV's usually make (was very annoyed by this).Next issue was the ports.... 2 hdmi, 2 component and a digital out....I was okay with it at first but using this tv for the family room with many devices just wasn't the best fit. In addition when we would try to switch hdmi inputs the TV would have problems adjusting to different devices and would give a message saying "display mode not supported". This was only resolved by using only 1 hdmi and switching the cable from one device to another.And make sure you a dark room for this TV otherwise you'll be watching yourself half the time, the screen is glass so its highly reflective.Also didn't like that the stand doesn't swivel, and the remote is cheap feeling compared to our other Samsung.As you know by now...we sent it back and thanks to amazon for all the assistance. We'll be getting a 1080p LCD.I'd only recommend this unit as a secondary tv or if you have few devices to connect, other than that....get an LCD.....they use less power too.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture !!  Samsung PN51D450 51-Inch
Reviews.Author: K. Keller "KenK"
Reviews.Content: This Plasma HDTV has the best picture I've seen in this price range and above, it took a little fiddling around with the picture settings out of the box, but the results are assume. The picture is so clear, bright and sharp you would never know it was a 720p Plasma if no one told you. I have another Plasma TV a 43 inch Panny that also has a Great picture but the picture on this Samsung is just that much better. I would like to mention the sound from this Tv is also very good, I have the Tv in a really large room and I have it set on 6 and it fills the hole room with sound, its loud compared to other sets I looked at, many sounded like tin cans.  The only complaint I have is there is only one sound out option, which is optical audio out, I have a pair of wireless head phones I use when watching Tv so I don't bother my family when I watch Tv and they need there quite time(they claim I'm def). The only option is to buy a optical to analog audio converter to hook them up, what happened to RCA, 1/8 audio jack connections? I see many Tvs are coming with only this optical audio out now, the converter companys must be happy about that.  Buy this set you won't be disappointed I know I'm not.

Reviews.Title: Finally a high end plasma with a low end price.
Reviews.Author: Kakaido
Reviews.Content: I am very tech savvy and know a lot about tech, So I will be very short with this review just trust me. This tv may not have tons of controls and only two HDMI but it's picture is worth the price. I did not buy this from Amazon I bought it from Fry's Electronics for $414.00 an AMAZING PRICE, Trust me get this tv you will be very happy.

Reviews.Title: Clear images and good sound (with Good Price)
Reviews.Author: John L. Kelly "John L Kelly"
Reviews.Content: This TV was viewed at Best Buy, along with several TVs. It was as sharp and clear as any TV in the store. The picture has great blacks and striking realistic picture and colors. It has good sound even though I usually listen with a Onkyo 7.1 surround system hooked up to it.Pros:1. This TV has no buzzing sounds often noticed on older Plasma TV's.  2. TV has a very clear picture with great color and even better Blacks.  3. My old 2008 Sony 52 inch TV cost approx 4X THE PRICE OF THIS TV.  4. This TV looks more realistic than my old Sony with colors that are not overstated or phony looking.Cons 1. This TV is only 720p not the 1080p I was looking for. Yet it is clearer and sharper looking than the SONY when it was new.  2. This TV has no internet capabilities, but this is OK because I own a Play Station 3 and get the internet (Netflix etc.) though it.  3. First TV arrived with broken screen, but in two days I had a new TV that worked wonderfully.If you have to have the status of owning a 1080p TV then do not get this TV. If you just want a great picture with great color than buy this soon.PS. Almost no TV's on the market today show a 1080p picture. They might have 1080 capability but in 2011 no cable or satellite company brings 1080 into the home (they broadcast 720p). Indeed. only a Blue ray player showing a movie filmed with a blue ray camera has true 1080ip All of these movies you could count on one hand in 2011. It will be 8 to 15 years before the cable subscribers all go to 1080p, and that the movies on Blue Ray are not just remastered DVD's. By that time you will need a new TV.

Reviews.Title: I like it, BUT....
Reviews.Author: azfreediver
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV about a month.  First, the negatives....Amazon emailed me the name of the company that would deliver it.  I guess for big ticket items, this is normal.  That company gave me a 7 day window for delivery.  Not much help, since I can't take 7 days off work for it, and who wants it left on their porch?  Repeated attempts to call were put on endless hold.  Emails were not replied to. Now I'm in the delivery window.  Stressed.  Finally got someone (in their collections dept-which seems to have more staff). They gave me the name of another company that they assign to deliver it!! I can call them to get an appointment for delivery.  Great?  No!  Eventually got someone (after 3 days of calling, and now 4 days into delivery window).  Speaks broken English.  They TELL me a date for delivery (outside of the window I was given) and a five hour window.  They said they'd call an hour before delivery (didn't).  Amazon emailed instructions that I should open the order and inspect for damage in the presence of the driver.  But the driver would not wait and just dumped it and dashed off in a hurry.  Bad experience all round.  But the TV is a beauty.  Easy set up.  If you play around with the settings, the image becomes even more superb. Sharp colors jump off the screen. Simple controls.  Does not have as many options for connecting DVD and VCR as some TVs.  When I connect my computer via HDMI, the TV says "mode not supported" and won't work, unlike my other TVs which I can play my computer through.  Wal-marts had the same TV in store but $50 CHEAPER last week, and no delivery stress.  Just pick it up and go...save money and hassle! Will not buy big ticket items through Amazon again. Amazon is great.  But not ancillary companies they use.

Reviews.Title: Best Value 51"  Plasma...STILL!
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Musa "mikeE"
Reviews.Content: I am sure a lot of people are happy with this set, just thought I'd put my cent or two. and so the story begins...I was on the market for a 42" HDTV for our Master Bedroom. I recently switched our 32" Sharp Aquos to the kids bedroom for their Panasonic 27" Analog TV. I know, what a downgrade but it's for the kids. To my surprise, the only input working are the RCA's in front of the TV (Input 2). I was like "eeehhh! what the heck, it's only for the bedroom, we'll wait for a sale when the time comes and get ourselves a 42". So while I was working, nature called and I had to empty my bladder. I went for a bathroom break and on my way out came across the local NY Daily News in the locker room. Skimmed through the pages and seen the Samsung PN51D430 advertised for $499.98 at PC Richards. I was like Wow! Told my wife the news when I got home and told her I was intrigue. We are a bit tight on cash but just want to look. Stopped by later that night and the salesman (of course) told me the model is discontinued but they have the newer version PN51D450 for $599.98, 25% off MSRP. He offered to drop the price to $549.98 if I take it that night. I said no and headed to another PC Richards to continue my search for the TV advertised.When I got there, sure enough the salesman told me the same story. 430 discontinued. They only have the 450 but its supposedly newer  and better model. To my surprise, he said I can have it for the same price of $499.98 and jokingly asked how many should he write up. I smiled and told him I'll think about it. What made me reluctant? 1. The display of the TV they had out on the floor is somewhat blurry as compared to the other sets, namely LED TV's. 2. As mentioned earlier, $$$ is tight, it's almost Christmas and good of a deal as it may, my account will definitely get a big dent. So I went on my smartphone and read more reviews on this set. I was caught in the Point of No Return, A Do or Die Situation. The deal is too good for me to pass on. Doing so will end up in nothing but regret. I know I will kick myself in the butt forever. So I came back to the floor and told the salesman I am ready. He finalized the sale and I went home  with the set. My wife just shook her head when I arrived but I can tell from her smile and her eyes of her approval and and  support.It wasn't until a few weeks later that I powered it up (One week before Christmas). The picture and clarity right from the factory settings is nothing compared to the way they had it displayed at the store. As a matter of fact, it was too bright for our eyes. Does it matter that its only 720P? No! the picture on this set is so clear and crisp. So far so good with our Scientific Atlanta Optimum HD cable box. It interlaces 1080 channels with no problem. At 600hz Sub-field motion, no  blur whatsoever on fast moving subjects. I'm sure it will be great for gaming. For the moment I have our Philips Progressive Scan DVD player via HDMI. Will be adding blu-ray soon. Our viewing distance from this set is a little more than 6 feet. Yes, its pretty big for a bedroom some may say but its perfect for ours. It is now mounted on the wall with all the wires hidden.As mentioned earlier, factory settings were set too bright. Had to turn the cell light down to 5, Contrast to 65, Brightness to 55, and Sharpness to 60. Also set the Eco-sensor on to automatically adjust the brightness when the lights are off.  Break-in - a rule of the thumb for all Plasmas is always suggested along with proper calibration afterwards. My other set - Samsung PN63B550 Full HD 1080P mounted in our living room went through this period. The same will be applied to this TV. Present settings seems to be just right in our eyes. The colors are vibrant and skin tones appear natural. I recently went to a Best Buy and showed my brother two sets of the same TV. One calibrated and one not. He likes the other set which was brighter. I pointed out the unnatural color and skin tones of the subjects and told him the one he didn't choose was the calibrated set. Our society seems to think the brighter, the better. Not necessarily true. I mean to each his own but then again, I would not want to view movies or shows that seems over exposed. I like the natural colors as if you were to see it in real life. (Funny how the "Goldfish" commercial just came on and I am comparing the colors to the one I am snacking on right now - Colors are on the money, All Natural!..lol.  All HD channels looks great on this set, especially The Food Network, HGTV, and ESPN.Recently just hooked this baby up with our aging Philips MCM-530 micro stereo system via RCA to Optical Toslink converter. It's not HD 5.1 but I can testify on the improved sound, especially in the bass area. Sure saved me $$$ from getting a soundbar.Cons of this set,Glare. Solution: Go figure. We are using this set in the bedroom so this is not an issue.Not enough HDMI input. Solution: HDMI switcher.Not a Smart TV. Solution: Buy one at a much higher price.Look at the reviews! The negative reviews on this site are just nit-picking. Anyway, If you are looking at this product and thinking of purchasing a TV this size, Go ahead and buy it!  This set delivers the picture clarity and crispness one look for on an HDTV. Trust me, it can rival most of the 1080P sets out there. I know, I own one. Guarantee you will not be disappointed.For the price I paid for, this one is practically a steal! Only problem now is that the kids are now claiming it..lolCheers! =)FOLLOW-UP: 10/10/12TV still Rocks! I have now hooked up an HDMI switcher ($14) and just using one HDMI port in all of my equipments. I added Roku stream player along with our Progressive Scan DVD player and we now switched to FIOS, so that means cable picture clarity is so much better. TV is probably on around 10 hours a day total. No burn-in, No issues whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: Great Value, Flawless Picture.
Reviews.Author: K. Coleman
Reviews.Content: This was a great purchase! I paid over $100 bucks less by using Amazon as opposed to my local box store. The delivery was free, and right on time. I could not be more pleased.As for the quality, you will not be disappointed at all. I cannot tell the difference between this picture and my 1080p Samsung in another room, and neither could my techno geek friends who all assumed it was a 1080p until I told them it wasn't.

Reviews.Title: Big Bang for the Bucks!
Reviews.Author: Phil Purdin "MacMan"
Reviews.Content: I bought this after a lot of research on 42" class sets. I use it in a guest bedroom that doubles as my football mancave. My cable hookup does not include a box with any high def capabilities in this room. I have that setup in my living room with a 1080 set. I was concerned that my picture quality would suffer, especially at 720p. Boy was I wrong. This set has some new technology that picks up all my favorite stations in a DTV Cable mode. The picture absolutely rivals my 1080 set with high def. Not exaggerating. That being said, the stations that are standard broadcast signals do suffer picture quality in comparison to the others, but not enough to warrant negative feedback. I was also concerned about plasma vs lcd etc., no problem since this is in a room I can darken with blinds to eliminate glare. I love the thin frame which provides a little more picture image and looks high tech compared to most. I really appreciate that there is no pixelation lag during fast motion live action.Connection options and overall features are great. I have no problem with sound quality in a small room, but would quickly add an external audio system if this were my primary entertainment system.When it comes time to replace my living room set, I will seriously consider a larger Samsung plasma unit with 1080p. I couldn't be happier with this purchase so far.

Reviews.Title: Great for The Money- Hands Down: Advantage-Amazon
Reviews.Author: believeinthestars
Reviews.Content: A trip to WalMart ended up in my purchase of the 43" Samsung Plasma from Amazon. I'm big on researching what's out there and most all the reviews for Samsung put it up there with the best. I always check reliability and again Samsung scores big there.  The rest comes down to scoring the best price. That's where Amazon came thru for me.  Amazon matched the WalMart price so the only other two factors where sales tax and shipping. Strike two, strike three:  no sales taxes and free shipping right to the living room!  Can't beat that.  I think I saved nearly a hundred bucks when factoring in those expenses. Samsung picture and sound are AMAZING and, if you can connect the unit to a sound system (even just your stereo receiver) you'll experience the full effect - awesome! The only downside to this unit is in the Plasma screen.. if it's in the wrong room, the shiny screen mirrors other objects in the room that can be distracting.  I just turn the lights off to watch and its all good. Overall this 43-inch is a noticeable step up from 40" units but the pricing is the same. Take advantage of it!

Reviews.Title: Change PS3 Display to 720p/1080i
Reviews.Author: Ha Dang "HQDeezy"
Reviews.Content: I was running Netflix through my PS3 and the audio wasn't synching with the stream correctly. So I went ahead and started to tinker/troubleshoot the problem and turns out that my PS3 was running at 1080p. Once deselected 1080p from the list of the displays the pixels and movement of were much more fluid and clear.EDIT: I just hooked up an AntennaCraft amplified OTA HDTV antenna to it last night and was able to pick up all the major local news channels in HD and it looks amazing with a 1080i feed! Wow. I am blown away with the picture quality. Now I can enjoy watching football in HD.

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV
Reviews.Author: mb
Reviews.Content: I like this TV very much. I looked at plasma, LCD, LED, and the plasma looked the best (rich colors, deep contrast, no motion blur). I paid $449 at HHGreg, a very good price compared to the other units.  The sound quality is very good; much better than I thought it would be (better than my last TV). This is important to me because I watch a lot of concert DVD's.  The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because when you view a video that was shot in 4:3 picture and you select 4:3 the bars on either side of the screen are grey?! not black. You can sellect between light grey and dark grey, but not black?! I would like black. In all I would recomend this TV if you don't use the 4:3 view a lot.

Reviews.Title: Lots to Like about this TV
Reviews.Author: Brian Wiebe
Reviews.Content: We've only been using this for a few days, so I can't give this any long-term feedback. However, after having shopped both online and in-store for quite awhile, I am pleased to say this is a great TV.We had actually purchased an LCD 40" 60Hz Sony Bravia from Costco, because we were nervous about the glare issue on the Plasma, but the LCD just didn't look right and the kids complained about it being blurry (due to the slower refresh rate, I presume), and back it went. We were really trying to keep our purchase to about $500, so that limited our choices.About this Samsung:Picture - beautiful, and much cleaner images than the LCD, even thought this is 720p not 1080p. We also do not have HD cable, and only a regular DVD player, not blu-ray. Still, it's very good.Gaming - the kids are happy, what can I say?The Glare - Yup, it's a problem. But we have curtains on the window which virtually eliminates the issue.Sound - just okay, but not terrible. We run sound through the stereo anyway.Features - nothing seems amissInput/Outputs - they really should have an analog (RCA) out, but the DVR, DVD player and Game Console can all be run to the stereo too. There are only 2 HDMI inputs, so far not a problem for us.So, having tried both types of TV's, I'm pleased with this choice.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV!
Reviews.Author: PM
Reviews.Content: I had the 2010 version of this TV. Loved it but the cleaners broke the glass after only 9 months. Repairs ran at $1000 so had to get a new TV. Found this one on Amazon. Picture quality is absolutely superb (as good as LED TV's priced 3 times). This one is thinner than its predessor and an inch larger. All in all a great buy!

Reviews.Title: Great flatscreen
Reviews.Author: Ticojon
Reviews.Content: Like most, I tended to shy away from anything that was 720p.  By chance I saw this one on sale at BJs after black Friday and the deal was too good to resist.  I own a 1080 television and this one has equal or better picture.  Come to find out...most broadcasts are 720p upscaled to 1080p (especially live broadcasts)...what a gimmick.  I don't think you'll find a better television (plasma, LCD or LED) unless you spend double the price of this one.  I'll mount mine later this week.  Don't fall for the super expensive HDMI cable 'gimmick' either.  Just get a fair priced, good quality cable from Amazon (read the reviews).

Reviews.Title: Look No Further in this Price Range......Purchase This !!
Reviews.Author: Andtiques Owner
Reviews.Content: I've only written two reviews of any kind before as I either have to be really upset or really impressed.  This is one impressive TV in this price range! Believe me when I say I did tons of research and reviewing before purchasing this TV.  When you add Amazon's Free Shipping and No Tax, you will set this up (in about 20 minutes or less) and feel like you've robbed them.  Shipped two days earlier than advertised with shipper bringing this into my home and my unpacking for inspection before he left! That's service!  Setup is very well illustrated and described and easy to understand and install. I'm using this in our Master Bedroom and it's the perfect size for that. I've ordered the wall mount but as now using on it's stand which is plenty sturdy.  Basic Picture tweaking is very easy and the results are superb.  I have a 52 inch LG in my "man cave" and while the display is larger, it isn't any better. Sound is very good with some decent Equalizer controls. The sound can be very loud, but the lower volume is quite comfortable.  Both Digital Regular and HD has deep blacks and vivid details.  A real joy to watch! I've used the photo and MP3 USB port for background music in my home and both the JPEG and MP3 player are awesome. I'm a bit enhanced as I have a Bose Surround Sound Theatre and wireless home system that really sets this baby off.  But this TV is great without any sound help as well. The remote works great from our distance of about 12 feet.  This set doesn't have a lot of Bells and Whistles, but it has all the essentials with 2 HDMI ports, 2 HD Component ports and a PC input if you have proper DVI hardware.  I only need the 2 HDMI's so these weren't important.  There is one note however from the advertisement that is wrong.  The USB only plays MP3's and JPEG photos, it DOES NOT play any videos at all. Again, this was no issue to me. Lastly, for the size and watching distance of a second television, the 720 dpi rivals my 1080 52" LG. If I were wanting big room display, I may not choose this one, but for this size, this is the very most bang for your buck out there.  Trust me, I researched and reviewed many long and hard hours before this decision and it paid off.  I've done all the researching for you..........if you are in the least tempted by this TV........buy it for Price, Service, Quality, Ease of Use, and Free Shipping. You won't go wrong with this TV at this price!!

Reviews.Title: What a television!
Reviews.Author: E. Hungerford
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had heard from other friends who had recently purchased a television that we should not buy a plasma tv, that the gases would dissipate and that the tv would not last as long as an LED or LCD.  Well, we read reviews on Amazon and decided this television was worth a try.  I mean, the price was so tempting!  At least 3 times cheaper than the LED and half the LCD.It's been a week, and we could not be more pleased.  Why are people buying the more expensive ones when this tv is so terrific?  The picture is clear, the sound is true, the screen presents no reflection problems. We feel that we could just step into the picture and join in the action.Try this tv; it's a winner!

Reviews.Title: Awesome picture, very good all overall.
Reviews.Author: Wineguy
Reviews.Content: I've had this for several months now. This TV can usually be had for $400 to $500. Don't be afraid of the plasma, this TV's picture is much better than any LCD at anywhere near the price. Its thin, adequately light, and has a thin bezel. It also avoids all of the dizzying motion issues that the LCDs have. This is great for general HDTV watching, Blueray looks incredible. You will have to crank up the color and contrast settings, but the color and motion displays on the this thing are the absolute best. Be careful depending on the exact model you buy that the amount of HDMI hookups vary from what you may see in a store, mine had only two which I luckily knew about ahead of time. Sound is clear and decent overall for this type of speakers.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 51" Plasma blows panel after 2 years!  Worthless..
Reviews.Author: Steven H Galloway
Reviews.Content: Beware of this product.  After just 2 years my 51 inch Samsung Plasma HDTV blew a panel resulting in a black horizontal line splitting the screen.  Researching this online I find that the problem is common with Samsung plasma products.  Unfortunately, I am outside the limited warranty and Samsung could not have been less helpful.  The replacement cost exceeds by far buying a brand new one!  I loved the TV until this happened.  I would not buy Samsung products again because of this.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't Be Happier With This TV
Reviews.Author: Wesley D. Sheffer
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for about 5 1/2 months now and am still thrilled with it. I had been looking at a 42" 720p Panasonic with IPTV capabilities for about $700, but when I looked at my new living room, it was just going to be too small. So I shopped some more and found this 51" beauty for $650.I've never seen a picture this good that I can remember. The colors are perfect, the blacks are deep, the viewing angle doesn't cut out until you're behind the TV, the sound is good. If this TV gives up anything to a 1080p unit, I can't tell. I've seen some (expensive) 1080p units that were just flat out disappointing or distracting to watch. No such complaints with this TV. It has all the sharpness of HD with the richness of a tube TV.One real detractor: glare is a problem in the daytime if you have a lot of windows, but it's not enough of a problem to make me want a different TV.Note: I'm glad I did not buy a TV with internet capabilities. There's no need to sink that cost into a TV when those functions will probably be duplicated and surpassed by any number of blue-ray players, cable boxes, other set-top boxes, or HTPCs that you will own between now and when the TV dies.

Reviews.Title: Great deal for price
Reviews.Author: phota syravong
Reviews.Content: I somehow got this from Amazon for $499 so I added to cart and was able to save over a hundred. The appearance of the plasma is a glossy piano black with very slim profile. Very modern look and lightweight compared to others. The quality is great and watching blue rays is awesome. Tried gaming on this system (PS3) and very clear at gaming. The TV has different settings for which type of mode i.e game, etc. The only drawback of this tv is it only has 2 hdmi ports, but I got around that by hooking up a hdmi 5 port. For this price its a great deal.

Reviews.Title: WONKA VISION
Reviews.Author: Justinthemovies
Reviews.Content: The picture on this TV is miraculous...rich...sharp..vivid..Colorful, bright hues, so realistic it looks as if the movie is coming in to your living room! LOVE, LOVE, LOVE THIS TV! Easy set-up, easy hook up...I am thrilled with it absolutely thrilled! My kids were watching Sponge Bob and it reminded me of Willie Wonka (the original of course) so much color!!!

Reviews.Title: Graet Value for the dollar!
Reviews.Author: rouse5369
Reviews.Content: This Tv has a bueatiful picture! for 720p and in high definition I dont see how you could get a better picture. I have read reviews saying the sound could be better. I agree out of the box it does sound a little cheap. You can adjust the sound settings with equalizer and surround sound and it then comes to life. I havent tried adjusting or tweaking the picture yet as it looks very good out of the box but im sure you can tweak it. i bought mine for 619.00 no tax and free shipping and couldnt be happier.I dont think you could find a better tv for the price!

Reviews.Title: No complaints
Reviews.Author: pudgsicle
Reviews.Content: I can't think of anything to complain about. It came, assembled easily, it worked and the rest is history :)

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted, arrived immediately
Reviews.Author: libertyville
Reviews.Content: I moved up from a big old heavy TV to this Samsung.  It exactly fits the corner cabinet and has just the right connections I need.  I have only had this 1 month, but so far so good.

Reviews.Title: First defective, second great
Reviews.Author: Jacob Stambaugh
Reviews.Content: For the price, this tv is awesome. The stand is, in my opinion, sturdy for the weight of the tv. The screen, although 720p, (and i think it's supposed to be 60hz...), looks fine. I suppose if I sat like a little kid at the foot of the tv  I could notice some pixilation. However, I don't, and it looks fine from 4 feet on.The only problem I did have was a pixil turned green and wouldn't change colors. This would seem to be a major problem, but samsung was unexpectedly helpful in getting it repaired, at no cost to me (as it was under 30 days. If it had been over I suppose it would have been a different story). Anyways, the screen was replaced and within a week I had a fixed tv. The tv repairman said I was lucky samsung allowed a new screen to be put in, as only one pixil was out. Apparently, other companies require a certain number to be out before they will do the repair. This could be wrong, but something to look into.So, plasma 43 inch for the price: I feel happy.

Reviews.Title: Spencer
Reviews.Author: spencer
Reviews.Content: Right out of the box this Samsung picture was great. The one concern is that the auto level setting doesn't work. The commercials are still louder than the program being watched.

Reviews.Title: A Winner by Samsung!!
Reviews.Author: E. Arroyo "Jazz Lover"
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is superb and sound is very good. Has minor reflection issues in lighten room, but this being a plasma screen, it is very minor.Biggest bang for your buck. Brightness and contrast controls are excellent.I recommend this TV 100%, glad I purchased it. Thank you Samsung!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the Price!
Reviews.Author: April
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV from our local Wal-Mart on July 3rd to replace our Panasonic plasma that died after 2 years. Could not believe we got a Samsung for $499! The slimline of the frame is good and it runs much cooler than other plasma TV's I've seen. After a few minutes of tweaking the settings, we got a beautiful picture with vibrant colors and deep blacks. You will not be disappointed with this TV. Don't forget the extended warranty. It"s always worth it on expensive electronics.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Richard Reynolds
Reviews.Content: The picture and function of this TV is great.  BUT, I have three issues people should be cognizant of before buying.Issue #1: "Internet connectivity."  It doesn't have any.Issue #2: Hooking up a surround stereo.  Unless you have a fairly new receiver which has a Digital Audio input you are out of luck.  I "assumed" it would have the "normal" RCA jacks for the audio, but it doesn't.  You'll need a new receiver if you don't want to use the TVs speakers.  The speakers are pretty decent, but it was a disappointment to find out I would have to spend another $200 for a surround sound receiver.Issue #3: No VGA input so don't plan on hooking your computer up to it.  None of thee things are advertised on the box, but buying a new TV can be a bit overwhelming to a lot of people. Just wanted to make this clear for people so they know what they're getting into.  I'd looked a bit longer had  I thought about these issues beforehand.  Its a great TV as far as picture goes.

Reviews.Title: Bad Warranty Service
Reviews.Author: ABE "Abe"
Reviews.Content: Bought this plasma tv in Oct 2011. It is August 2012 and the screen has a red haze in the middle of the screen. There are vertical bars on both sides of the red haze. The red haze is solid and consistent and has no other ghosting image.Well, I sent in a repair request and received an email from ther authorized service department. They asked if I could send pitures of the issue and I did. Shortly after their response was that it is a burn in issue and not covered under warranty. I called Samsung directly to dispute their findings and Samsung directed me to their executive customer relations. Long story short - they also claim the issue is burn in.My point - I have 3 plasma TVs, this is the newest of the 3 and only this has a problem. Samsung never sent out a technician to even look at my tv or have me send the tv to them. They just concluded the problem based on pictures I sent them. (Somehow this makes me feel foolish). I know what most burn in/ghosting look like. I have had them on my other plasma TVs and easily removed. Never permanent.I will never buy another Samsung product because I feel that they don't stand behind their product.

Reviews.Title: Died after a little over a year.
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: TV worked fine when I had it working! A couple weeks ago the unit just decided to not turn on. The light just stays red and makes a clicking noise when I try to turn it on. Silly to have to replace a unit barely over a year old. Samsung won't do anything. Had a surge protector on the unit, never moved.

Reviews.Title: Very nice bedroom TV
Reviews.Author: Just a guy
Reviews.Content: We have this in our bedroom and like it a lot.  The TV has a really nice picture and - although there are no web services - it is perfectly adequate for everyday tv viewing.  We have it hooked up with a cable box and a roku box.  The firmware and interface are common across all Samsung tvs - give or take a few features.  I find the menus clear and intuitive. We use the turn on timer as a daily alarm clock.  It works fine.  The clock keeps decent time.My only complaint is that the inputs on the back stick straight out the back - thus your cables inhibit the ability to mount this close to the wall.  Other Samsung models - even the 22" model - have the inputs run parallel to the screen, so the connectors don't interfere with a mounting bracket.The sound on this is pretty good.  Since it is in our bedroom, we dont have it hooked up to a home theater - we actually use the included speakers. They are pleanty powerful and certainly good enough for everyday viewing.  We even use the "music stations" from our cable provider when we want music in the bedroom.  The sound is acceptable for that.I like this tv a lot.

Reviews.Title: WHITES FLICKER
Reviews.Author: lothar
Reviews.Content: Samsung PN43D450 43-Inch 720p 600 Hz Plasma HDTV (Black) I had heard of some Samsung flickers  in their plasma but thought can't be real. Well it was. Do the picture test, look just outside the TV frame and you will see light colors, green yellow and esp white, vibrating pretty fast. At least on my unit. The problem was more evident when watching hockey or news when they may have charts or dynamic contrasts and whites.The low rating is due to the BS I experienced with Samsung Canada customer service, service center asking me to do more testing, and eventually the easier solution was still taking it back at BestBuy...

Reviews.Title: No Analog Audio Out
Reviews.Author: J. Orvis
Reviews.Content: I don't have much to say yet about this TV as I have barely used it so I'll do an update later.Right now I just wanted to point out that there is no analog audio out.  The description says there is analog out on the side but there isn't.This means that unless your audio system uses digital audio or you have a converter you won't be able to hook it up to this TV.The description also lists an Ethernet jack but clearly there isn't one.

Reviews.Title: great TV!
Reviews.Author: JBergevin
Reviews.Content: I have the 51" Samsung plasma (PN51d450) and absolutely love it! I was concerned that 720p would diminish my viewing experience but after reading the reviews decided to give it a try.  When seeing it next to others in a store, the video didn't look as good as some of the other sets...then I read about the "tricks of the trade" stores use to push certain products over others.  One of them being changing hues and contrasts to display a less than optimal picture on sets where the profit margins are lower.I ordered this set and am thrilled with its picture quality and its sound.  The only draw back I can think of is the fact that it only has two HDMI inputs.  I currently only have the need for one anyway so I'm nit picking here.  Great set at the best price I have seen.  You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Plasma PN43D450
Reviews.Author: Trebor
Reviews.Content: Purchased this as a B-Day Present Sept 2011 for mum she upgraded from a 15yr old 25" Sony. Worked great for a week then the power board blew, Samsung tech was out in week said All the new plasma tv's are running too small of power boards. No problems since mum really loves it, great picture esp w/HD cable hooked up much more real looking picture compared to an LCD I think. Going to purchase one for myself soon.

Reviews.Title: Top Notch Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Logan
Reviews.Content: I researched tv's a lot before coming to the conclusion that this was the best buy in this price range. After finding that the plasma had the edge over the lcd in many aspects(more viewing angles, darker blacks, brighter colors, etc.) I chose to go with plasma. If you're worried about burn in, don't be. Just do the precautionary break in and you will be completely fine. I have this hooked up to a home theater system and I couldn't be more happy with the outcome. The picture quality is stunning. It has definitely made me a fan of samsung. I would absolutely recommend this tv.

Reviews.Title: Purchased at a GREAT PRICE from amazon
Reviews.Author: Franky Franks
Reviews.Content: The picture is great, the colors are deep and vivid. You will have to do a little adjustments to the settings, but it's easy. The 51" screen size is nice and I purchased this for a great price of $499. Amazon has some great deals, you just have to check often because they might only last for an hour or two. This was the best price anywhere!

Reviews.Title: Get 'em, coach!
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: Alright, here's the skinny: I bought this set during the black friday sales this year at BB for $399. I was debating between this set and a 47" Panasonic for the same price. After being able to see set, I decided to go for this set because the panasonic, despite being 1080p, had a very grainy picture. Fast forward 2 weeks, and I am happily viewing a plethora of TV shows and movies on this television. Browse AVSforums if you want further insight on how to improve your viewing experience when using this set.Personal gems that I would like to point out:- while "breaking in" this plasma, I accidentally forgot to loop playback of the color transistions. So after 40 minutes, the video stopped and the tv displayed my windows 7 desktop... for 6 hours while I was asleep. I was terrified when I woke up, fearing burn in/image retention. Alas, none were to be found.- touch screen buttons on the bottom left (they don't stick out so people used to CRTs, like myself, will be searching for protruding buttons for a while)Do yourself a favor and upgrade your old/smaller tv to this one. The picture is amazing!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture, great value
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for about a week now and I can't say enough good things about it! The picture on this is absolutely awesome! The colors are rich and deep. Black blacks. I've watched quite a few sporting events on this and there's no problems with fast moving action. The screen is pretty reflective so that could be a problem for some people. I have it in the brightest room in my house(none of them are particularly bright though) and it hasn't been an issue for me. If you want to put this in a room with a lot of windows and lots of light you may want to look at some other options. The only other drawback is that there are not a lot of connections. There are 2 HDMI and 2 component connections. Of course, you can always pick up a switch/hub to rectify this so it's not really a big deal. Aside from the picture being great, the sound from this TV is surprisingly good. Most of the value priced flat panel TVs that I've heard have been lacking in that category. For around $500 you really can't go wrong with this TV. This is a great buy!

Reviews.Title: deal!
Reviews.Author: Harold Bowen
Reviews.Content: Purchased this unit (43") on Saturday after Black Friday for $350.00! Store (Meijer's) had a LOT of discounts going on.  This looks great so far and give a great HD picture quality. Sound is pretty good but wish it did have a "sound jack out" for sound for my old amplifier. It only has the digital sound output option. I solved this by running the sound through my cable box, then to the older amplifier. I will update this after I have it for awhile; so far it looks great in my rec. room!

Reviews.Title: great plasma
Reviews.Author: Lee
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice tv for less. TVs are getting better and better and prices are getting lower and lower every year. No need to get the expensive one.Comparing to what we had few years ago. It's a perfect TV.settle with one nice TV and save some money in this economy.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: CraiginCali
Reviews.Content: I have never been able to tell the difference between a 1080i and 1080P picture with regards to quality of the picture. This TV has a crystal clear picture and is great for watching sports, which is the primary function for is set since it is located in the "Man Cave".  For the price, this is an outstanding value. I was really surprised at the quality of the sound that this unit produces. Very pleased with the product so far.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal for Quality
Reviews.Author: Timothy Mitchell
Reviews.Content: For this product being my first flat TV it been like having front row seats at the movies. Keep in mine for this TV is all H.D. it will require newer equipment so I bought a PS3 to watch shows and play a little. It has great picture and sound, I do not need some kind of sound system to enjoy every thing I do also it is vary simple to set up any HD device in to it. So if you get a chance to get this deal, it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: good TV
Reviews.Author: Zelron
Reviews.Content: This is my first HDTV and the build + picture quality is outstanding. I went to a local store to look at it side by side with other Plasmas and LED TV...this one looks the best in terms of design and picture (for its price range).The screen can output an awesome black...and the built-in speaker is sufficient for regular TV watching.This is a basic HDTV that offers good picture and sound quality. Perfect for a bedroom or if you just want to stream stuff to watch online. I would get a bigger / higher resolution TV for blu-ray viewing though.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: jake j
Reviews.Content: i confess i paid $478 for this one at walmart(had to have it in time for the lsu v oregon game)...but it was worth every penny.  you might be thinking 'only 720p?' but of all the tvs i looked at(and there were quite a few)this one had the sharpest contrast,brightest colors, and overall best picture of any i saw except the extreme high end tvs.  the sound was not theater quality, but surprisingly better than i expected after some reviews i read.  it is a plasma, so you do have a glossy screen--just adjust room lights so you don't get glare.  and while i don't enjoy doing it, going into the settings and tweaking the picture to your liking will greatly improve the picture(factory settings weren't the best for me).  oh, did i mention that in price vs size vs quality i think it beat any led/lcd that i saw?

Reviews.Title: Impressive qualtiy HDTV for the money
Reviews.Author: Amazoned
Reviews.Content: We bought this as simply a TV monitor, with video source coming from cable (720p HD), and Xbox Kinect.This Samsung may not be the cheapest in its class, but its price still very attractive.
